id.title: Repository identifier
id.description: Handle identifier of the NKR record (autogenerated)

repositoryName.title: Repository name
repositoryName.description: Official repository name (usually in the original language).

additionalName.title: Alternative repository names
additionalName.description: Alternative repository name or acronym of the official repository name.

type.title: Repository type
type.description: Repository type according to its content and purpose.

status.title: Repository status
status.description: Actual repository development or production status.

startProduction.title: Start of production phase
startProduction.description: The date when the repository moves or will move into the production phase. This can also be a planned date in the future.

endProduction.title: End of production phase
endProduction.description: The date when the repository has passed or will pass into the decommissioned phase. This may also be a planned date in the future.

subject.title: Subject classification
subject.description: Field(s) to which the repository content is dedicated, as defined by the Frascati Manual.

keywordCz.title: Keywords in Czech
keywordCz.description: Freely formed keyword in Czech that describes the content and focus of the repository.

keywordEn.title: Keywords in English
keywordEn.description: Freely formed keyword in English that describes the content and focus of the repository.

mainUrl.title: Main repository URL
mainUrl.description: URL of the repository home page.

mainContact.title: Main contact
mainContact.description: Contact for the end-user, e.g. a generic email.

organization.title: Organizations
organization.description: Organization(s) responsible for the repository management or specific part of the repository management (could be large research infrastructure or consortium).

repoGit.title: Git platforms
repoGit.description: The repository or organization on GitHub or another platform for code versioning (URL address of the project landing page on Git or another platform) for general or customized software used for desribed repository.

versioning.title: Versioning support
versioning.description: Information if the repository supports versioning of files and metadata.

pidType.title: Persistent identifier type used in the repository
pidType.description: For definiton of PIDs in the repository, use the Wikidata address of the identifier, eg. https://www.wikidata.org/entity/Q25670 for DOI identifier used in described repository.

doiPrefix.title: DOI prefixes
doiPrefix.description: If the repository provides DOI identifier(s), enter the DOI prefix(es).

handlePrefix.title: Handle prefixes
handlePrefix.description: If the repository provides Handle identifier(s), enter the Handle prefix(es).

pidPerson.title: Supported persistent identifiers for persons
pidPerson.description: Select the type of persistent identifiers which are used in the repository for person identification.

relatedPublication.title: Support for related publications
relatedPublication.description: Information if the repository offers the possibility to link metadata records of the datasets with metadata of another related resources (articles, software, another datasets etc.).

certificate.title: Repository certification
certificate.description: The type of certification that the repository has obtained.

metadataStandard.title: Metadata standards
metadataStandard.description: Metadata standards used in the repository.

metadataStandardUsage.title: Usage
metadataStandardUsage.description: Usage of the metadata standard in the repository.

restApi.title: Repository REST API
restApi.description: Information about the repository REST API.

restApiEndpoint.title: Endpoint
restApiEndpoint.description: REST API endpoint (URL address) of the repository.

restApiSpecification.title: Specification
restApiSpecification.description: Documentation or specification of the repository REST API (a set of instructions on how to work with API and how to send queries, eg. OpenAPI specification).

sparqlApi.title: Repository SPARQL API
sparqlApi.description: Information about the repository SPARQL API.

sparqlApiEndpoint.title: Endpoint
sparqlApiEndpoint.description: SPARQL API endpoint (URL address) of the repository.

sparqlApiSpecification.title: Specification
sparqlApiSpecification.description: Documentation or specification of the repository SPARQL API (a set of instructions on how to work with the API and how to send queries).

oaipmhEndpoint.description: OAI-PMH endpoint (URL address) of the repository.
oaipmhEndpoint.title: OAI-PMH endpoint

documentationTech.title: Technical documentation
documentationTech.description: Repository technical documentation (repository architecture, parameters of used software, functions etc.).

documentationUser.title: User documentation
documentationUser.description: Repository user documentation (for using the repository).

controlledVocabulary.title: Controlled vocabularies
controlledVocabulary.description: Controlled vocabularies used in the repository.

datasetMaxSize.title: Dataset size limit
datasetMaxSize.description: The maximum possible size of the uploaded dataset. Please specify in GB.

sensitiveData.title: Support for sensitive data
sensitiveData.description: Information if the repository supports sensitive data deposit.

fip.title: FAIR Implementation Profiles
fip.description: FAIR Implementation Profiles linked to the repository.

relatedRegistry.title: Registry record
relatedRegistry.description: Information on whether the repository is registered.

indexedIn.title: Indexed in aggregator
indexedIn.description: Information on whether the repository is indexed in an aggregator.

indexedInUrl.title: URL of the repository in the aggregator
indexedInUrl.description: URL address that points to the repository records indexed in the aggragator. Example: https://explore.openaire.eu/search/dataprovider?datasourceId=opendoar____::01894d6f048493d2cacde3c579c315a3

remarks.description: Any remarks which are not possible to enter in another field.
remarks.title: Remarks
